results.title: Sumatra: island of the Bataks
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Indonesia”

results.title: Sumatra: island of rice and rubber
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Indonesia”
Scenes of life in Sumatra, one of the many islands of Indonesia. Shows the agricultural development and methods used by the rural population. Village life style and customs are also seen.

results.title: Sultans of swing: the very best of Dire Straits
results.creator_credit: Marghie Evans and PolyGram Video International
results.brief_description: ‘Sultans of swing’ features 16 of Dire Strait’s most popular songs including: “Sultans of swing”, “Lady writer”, “Romeo and Juliet”, “Tunnel of love”, “Private investigations”, “Twisting by the pool”, “Love over gold (live)”, “So far away”, “Money for nothing”, “Brothers in arms”, “Walk of life”, “Calling Elvis”, “Heavy fuel”, “On every street”, “Your latest trick (live)” and “Local hero - wild theme (live)”.

results.title: Sulphur and its compounds. - 2nd ed.
results.brief_description: Using molecular models, animation and time-lapse photography, this film demonstrates the chemical and physical properties of sulphur, including the formation of its allotropic forms. Also describes the Frasch process, and emphasises the importance of sulphur and its compounds, especially sulphuric acid, in modern industry, medicine and agriculture.

results.title: Suivez-Moi Jeune Homme! = Follow Me Young Man!
results.creator_credit: Guy Le Franc, Marcel Lathiere and Paul Cadeac
results.brief_description:
Oranos, a wealthy greek business man, is in love with Francoise, a jewellery shop attendant, who consistantly rebuffs him. Suspecting she may already have a boyfriend, he is having her followed by Michel, a private detective, who promptly falls in love with her.

Credits: Producer, Paul Cadeac, Marcel Lathiere ; director, Guy Le Franc ; writers, Roland Moronval, Jean Halain ; photography, Maurice Barry ; music, Louiguy.
Cast: Dany Robin, Daniel Gelin, Lona Rita, Jacques Jouanneau, Noel Roquevert, Georges Chamarat, Michel Galabru, Fernand Sardoux.

results.title: Suicide trail

results.title: Suicide box
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description: A documentary video tape about the ‘Suicide Box’ - a motion triggered camera developed by the Bureau of Inverse Technology (a private information agency) and installed in range of the Golden Gate Bridge, San Fransisco. This vertical-motion triggered device is designed to capture a video record of anything that falls from the bridge in order to provide an accurate measure of the suicide rate at the bridge. Accuracy of measurement is often compromised by the presence of seagulls and brought into question by ironic observations about the contradictory roles played by technology within contemporary culture.

results.title: Suho and the white horse
results.brief_description: Legend has it that love shared by a poor shepherd lad and the white foal he finds on the Mongolian steppes underlies the creation of the first horse-head fiddle. A deeply moving story based on the children’s picture book.

results.title: Suggested photo spots
results.brief_description: Strap on your seat belts and get comfortable for a 7,000 mile drive. This documentary invites you to travel along with the Center for Land Use Interpretation as they find Suggested Photo Spots across North America. Journey from coast to coast stopping long enough to take snap shots of unusual or exemplary land use sites across North America. You will even get to take a picture of Kodak’s own waste water treatment plant in Rochester, New York.
